author: Clarissa Dickson Wright
method: Place the rabbit fillets between two pieces of cling film and bash lightly with a meat hammer or rolling pin until ½cm/¼in thick.  Remove the cling film and place the bacon and sage leaves in between the fillets. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat the oil in a lidded frying pan and fry the rabbit fillets for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown. Pour over the beer or wine and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover and cook for another 10 minutes.
ingredients: 2 rabbit fillets,  2 slices back bacon,  2 fresh sage leaves,  1 tbsp olive oil,  150ml/5fl oz beer or white wine
